hanzi-su-wiki:
裳

Значения

Юбка; одежда, бельё

Мнемоника

Парадная 尚 одежда 衣, т.е. костюм.
purpleculture_pinyin:
cháng
lower garment; skirts; petticoats; garments
нижняя одежда; юбки; юбки; одежда
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 尚 indicates the sound; 衣 (clothes) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
霓裳 [ ní cháng ]: Nichang, abbr. for the Tang Dynasty song "Raiment of Rainbows and Feathers" 霓裳羽衣曲
霓裳 [ ní cháng ]: nichang, rainbow colored clothes worn by the Eight Immortals 八仙
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 尚 [ shàng ] still, yet; even; fairly, rather
    • 衣 [ yī ] cloth; clothes, apparel; dress, coat
heisig_chinese_memo: Compared to pants, a skirt is true raiment (especially decorative clothing).  It can be work for a night out and when you want to use one of those Chinese toilets. It makes it so much easier: you just walk in the outhouse hike it up, and do your business.
heisig_constituent: skirt, outhouse, small, little, crown, mouth, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment
heisig_story: The key word refers to an ancient skirt once used as part of a woman's costume. The primitives you have to work with are: outhouse . . . garment.
koohiiStory1: Compared to pants, a SKIRT is the GARMENT to be wearing when you want to use one of those Japanese toilets. It makes it so much easier: you just walk in the OUTHOUSE hike it up, and do your business.
koohiiStory2: Haven´t you ever noticed that the men / women signs on the front of outhouses are sometimes very similar? The silhouettes are usually the same, but one will decidedly be wearing a garment in the shape of a SKIRT. Also, we´ve already learned the kanji for "woman", so if the signs are only in kanji you have no right to wander in and claim ignorance, perv!
Ru_trainchinese:
shang: (графема) одежда
cháng: (графема) (устар.) юбка
Kanshudo_mnemonic: in the classroom (龸) the mouth (口) uses the clothes (衣) to make a skirt
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Compared to pants, a skirt is true raiment (especially decorative clothing).  It can be work for a night out and when you want to use one of those Chinese toilets. It makes it so much easier: you just walk in the outhouse hike it up, and do your business.
humanum_short_description_en: "Said the text": "... Often, also from the towel still under Qun Sang sound, or often from clothes," according to "Wen said,", " Sang " is the " often " or the body, see " often ."
humanum_short_description: 《說文》：「常，下帬也。從巾尚聲。裳，常或從衣。」據《說文》，「裳」乃「常」之或體，參見「常」。

Heisig: The key word refers to an ancient skirt once used as part of a woman's costume. The primitives you have to work with are: outhouse . . . garment.
Chinese: Compared to pants, a skirt is true raiment (especially decorative clothing). It can be work for a night out and when you want to use one of those Chinese toilets. It makes it so much easier: you just walk in the outhouse hike it up, and do your business.
koohii1: Compared to pants, a SKIRT is the GARMENT to be wearing when you want to use one of those Japanese toilets. It makes it so much easier: you just walk in the OUTHOUSE hike it up, and do your business.
koohii2: Haven´t you ever noticed that the men / women signs on the front of outhouses are sometimes very similar? The silhouettes are usually the same, but one will decidedly be wearing a garment in the shape of a SKIRT. Also, we´ve already learned the kanji for "woman", so if the signs are only in kanji you have no right to wander in and claim ignorance, perv!

裳字的基本解释

裳
cháng
〔裳裳〕光明。
古代指遮蔽下体的衣裙。

裳
shɑng
〔衣裳〕衣服。

裳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chéng］
［《廣韻》市羊切，平陽，禪。］
(1)古代称下身穿的衣裙，男女皆服。
(2)泛指衣服。
(3)见“裳裳”。
(4)通“常”。

裳字的英文翻译

◎ 裳
skirt

裳字的康熙字典解释

【申集下】【衣字部】　裳； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1118第36
【唐韻】市羊切【集韻】【韻會】辰羊切【正韻】陳羊切，?音常。【說文】下帬也。【釋名】下曰裳。裳，障也，所以自障蔽也。【詩·邶風】綠衣黃裳。【禮·曲禮】暑無褰裳。【揚子·方言】惜乎衣未成而轉爲裳也。【集韻】本作常。

裳字的源字形

裳字的起名意思

古人穿的遮蔽下体的衣裙，男女都穿，是裙的一种，不是裤子 。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chéng］
["Guangyun" City Sheep Cut, Pingyang, Zen. ]
(1) In ancient times, the dress worn on the lower body was called for both men and women.
(2) Refers to clothes in general.
(3) See "Shangshang".
(4) It is always "always".

Source glyph
skirts
Name meaning
The dress that the ancients wore to cover the lower body was worn by both men and women. It was a kind of skirt, not pants.
形声字。衣表意,其古文字形体像一件衣服,表示和衣服有关,尚(shang )表声,尚有崇尚义,反映出古时人们崇尚服
饰。本义指下身的衣服。后泛指衣服。

裳
cháng / shang
蒙。
裳
楷
Пиктофонетические символы.
Одежда выражает значение, ее древние символы подобны предмету одежды, указывая на то, что она связана с одеждой. Шан (шан) выражает значение, которое отражает восхищение одеждой в древние времена.
Первоначальное значение относится к одежде нижней части тела.
После обращения к одежде.
Нижняя одежда, которую носили древние из Очанга, - это юбка ... типа, как мужчины, так и женщины носят: зеленую одежду.
Желтый ~.
Одежда Oshang [Nongshang].
О одежда ~
